properties.areaDesc: Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:07PM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
...EXTENDED PERIOD OF WINTER WEATHER CONTINUES...

.Numerous cold, wet weather systems will continue to push through
the area over the next several days. Colder air is expected to
arrive with each sequential wave, thus snow levels will steadily
lower through the weekend. Many winter weather headlines have been
extended out though Monday, or have been expanded to cover more
area. Winter weather will continue into the middle of next week.

* WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2500 feet, heavy snow
expected. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 15 inches. Winds
gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Weather Advisory
between 2000 and 2500 feet, snow expected. Total snow
accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40
mph.

* WHERE...The winter storm warning covers elevations above 2500
feet in eastern Curry County and Josephine County, including
Oregon Caves. The winter weather advisory covers elevations
between generally 2000 and 2500 feet, including the Interstate
5 passes north of Grants Pass.

* WHEN...From 4 AM Monday to 10 AM PST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult due to slick and snow
covered roads, and may impact the morning commute. Periods of
gusty winds may produce lower visibilities due to blowing and
drifting snow.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions.

* If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets,
food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you.

* The safest place during a winter storm is indoors.

* A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely
and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action
now.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 2500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 10 AM PST TUESDAY BETWEEN 2000 AND 2500 FEET
